Package com.redis.ds.ds_redis.search

Class RedisSearch

java.lang.Object
com.redis.ds.ds_redis.search.RedisSearch
public class RedisSearch extends Object
The RedisSearch class is responsible for accessing the RediSearch module commands via the Jedis programmatic library. It designed to simplify the use of core Foundation class objects like items, documents and grids. You can instantiate this class from the parent RedisDS class. The goal of class is to showcase most of the features of RediSearch which means that the search index created will be larger because each field could be saved with different options such as stemming, tags, phonetics and sortable.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

    • setDataSchema

      public void setDataSchema(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSchemaDoc)
      Assigns the data document instance as the schema definition. The data schema definition is tracked in this package as a convenience to the calling application and used when the parent application needs to add, update or delete documents in the search index.
      Parameters:
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance

      Returns:
      Data schema data document definition

      Assigns the data document instance as the schema definition.
      Parameters:
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance

    • getSearchSchema

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc getSearchSchema()
      Retrieves the internal search schema data document definition.
      Returns:
      Search schema data document definition

    • getIndexName

      public String getIndexName()
      Retrieves the search index name based on how it was assigned in the data source. If an index name was assigned to the schema, then it used first. Next, the internal index name member is selected. Finally, if the first two do not yield a name, then the "search_index" application property is used.
      Returns:
      Search index name

    • createSchemaDoc

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc createSchemaDoc(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataSchemaDoc, String anIndexName)
      Creates a data document with items suitable for a default search schema. The logic assumes that all of the data schema fields should be included in the search schema.
      Parameters:
      aDataSchemaDoc - Data schema document instance
      anIndexName - Name of the search index
      Returns:
      Data document representing a search schema

    • createSchemaDoc

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc createSchemaDoc(String aName)
      Creates a data document with items suitable for a schema editor UI.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the schema
      Returns:
      Data document representing a schema

      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the feature
      Returns:
      true or false

    • schemaDocToDataGrid

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid schemaDocToDataGrid(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSchemaDoc, boolean anIsExtended)
      Convert a data document schema definition into a data grid suitable for rendering in a schema editor UI.
      Parameters:
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance (representing the schema)
      anIsExtended - If true, then non standard features will be recognized
      Returns:
      Data grid representing the schema definition

    • dataGridToSchemaDoc

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc dataGridToSchemaDoc(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid)
      Collapses a data grid representing a schema definition back into a data document schema. This method assumes that you invoked the schemaDocToDataGrid() method to build the data grid originally.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      Returns:
      Data document schema definition

    • saveSchemaDefinition

      public void saveSchemaDefinition(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSearchSchemaDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Stores the search schema definition in the Redis database. This schema definition is one that could be used by a parent application to describe the current search schema.
      Parameters:
      aSearchSchemaDoc - Search schema data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • saveSchemaDefinition

      public void saveSchemaDefinition() throws RedisDSException
      Stores the search schema definition in the Redis database. This schema definition is one that could be used by a parent application to describe the current search schema.
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • createIndexSaveSchema

      Create a RediSearch index with a schema based on the data document and data source criteria instances.
      Parameters:
      aSearchSchemaDoc - Data document for scheme definition
      aDSCriteria - Data source criteria for index definition
      Returns:
      true if the operation succeeded or false otherwise

    • schemaExists

      public boolean schemaExists() throws RedisDSException
      Identifies if the schema definition for the search index has been stored in the Redis DB.
      Returns:
      true if it exists and false otherwise
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • loadSchema

      public Optional<com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc> loadSchema() throws RedisDSException
      Loads the schema definition from the Redis DB into a data document instance. If the load fails or the key does not exist, then the optional data document will not be present.
      Returns:
      Optional data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • updateSchema

      public boolean updateSchema(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aSchemaDoc)
      Updates the data items captured in the schema document parameter DataDoc against the current search schema. The data items must be derived from the schema definition. Note: Once the update has been applied, the RediSearch index will be out-of-sync with it, so you need to rebuild the search index to reflect these changes.
      Parameters:
      aSchemaDoc - Data document instance
      Returns:
      true if the search index should be rebuilt and false otherwise

    • addHiddenDocumentId

      public void addHiddenDocumentId(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc)
      Convenience method that adds a unique document id item to the data document instance.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance

      aPayloadItem - Payload item instance
      Returns:

      aLimit - Limit of suggestions

    • add

      public void add(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Adds the data document to the search index. The data document must designate a primary field using the Data.FEATURE_IS_PRIMARY feature.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • add

      public void add(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid) throws RedisDSException
      Adds the data grid to the search index. The data document must designate a primary field using the Data.FEATURE_IS_PRIMARY feature.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source failure

    • add

      public void add(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid, com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Adds the data document as a row to the end of the data grid in the Redis database and its corresponding search index. The key name is obtained from the feature Redis.REDIS_FEATURE_KEY_NAME. Note: This method does not add the data document instance to the end of the data grid instance. You must reload the data grid from the Redis database.
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis operation failure

    • add

      public void add(List<com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc> aDataDocList) throws RedisDSException
      Adds the data document list to the search index. The data document must designate a primary field using the Data.FEATURE_IS_PRIMARY feature.
      Parameters:
      aDataDocList - List of data documents
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source failure

    • update

      public void update(com.redis.foundation.data.DataDoc aDataDoc) throws RedisDSException
      Updates the data document to the search index. The data document must designate a primary field using the Data.FEATURE_IS_PRIMARY feature.
      Parameters:
      aDataDoc - Data document instance
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • query

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid query(com.redis.foundation.ds.DSCriteria aDSCriteria, int anOffset, int aLimit) throws RedisDSException
      Returns a DataGrid representation of the documents that match the DSCriteria in the search index. In addition, this method offers a paging mechanism where the starting offset and a fetch limit can be applied to each content fetch query.
      Parameters:
      aDSCriteria - Data source criteria.
      anOffset - Starting offset into the matching content rows.
      aLimit - Limit on the total number of rows to extract from the content source during this fetch operation.
      Returns:
      Data grid representing all rows that match the criteria in the search index (based on the offset and limit values).
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • query

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid query(com.redis.foundation.ds.DSCriteria aDSCriteria) throws RedisDSException
      Returns a DataGrid representation of the documents that match the DSCriteria in the search index.
      Parameters:
      aDSCriteria - Data source criteria.
      Returns:
      Data grid representing all rows that match the criteria in the search index.
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - RediSearch data source exception

    • calculateFacets

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid calculateFacets(com.redis.foundation.ds.DSCriteria aDSCriteria) throws RedisDSException
      Returns a DataGrid representation of the field facets that match the DSCriteria in the search index.
      Parameters:
      aDSCriteria - Data source criteria.
      Returns:
      Data grid representing all rows that match the criteria in the search index.
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • calculateUIFacets

      public com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid calculateUIFacets(com.redis.foundation.ds.DSCriteria aDSCriteria) throws RedisDSException

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      Data grid representing all rows that match the criteria in the search index.
      Throws:

      Throws:

    • indexExists

      public boolean indexExists()
      Returns true if the search index exists and false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the search index exists and false otherwise

    • dropIndex

      public void dropIndex(boolean aDeleteHashes) throws RedisDSException
      Drops the search index from the Redis database and deletes any related hash documents (if parameter is true).
      Parameters:
      aDeleteHashes - If true, then document hashes will be deleted too
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception

    • dropIndex

      public void dropIndex(com.redis.foundation.data.DataGrid aDataGrid) throws RedisDSException
      Drops the search index from the Redis database and deletes any related hash documents (if parameter is true).
      Parameters:
      aDataGrid - Data grid instance (implies hash deletion)
      Throws:
      RedisDSException - Redis data source exception
